'# The following code to create a dataframe and remove duplicated rows is always executed and acts as a preamble for your script: 

# dataset = pandas.DataFrame(status_binary, risk_level)
# dataset = dataset.drop_duplicates()

# Paste or type your script code here:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from sklearn.metrics import precision_score, recall_score, f1_score

df = dataset.copy()
y_true = df[''status_binary'']
y_prob = df[''risk_score'']

# Evaluate metrics across thresholds
thresholds = [i/100 for i in range(10, 90, 5)]  # 0.10 to 0.85
results = []

for t in thresholds:
    y_pred = (y_prob > t).astype(int)
    precision = precision_score(y_true, y_pred)
    recall = recall_score(y_true, y_pred)
    f1 = f1_score(y_true, y_pred)
    results.append((t, precision, recall, f1))

# Convert to DataFrame
metrics_df = pd.DataFrame(results, columns=[''Threshold'', ''Precision'', ''Recall'', ''F1''])

# Plot
plt.figure(figsize=(8, 5))
plt.plot(metrics_df[''Threshold''], metrics_df[''Precision''], label=''Precision'', marker=''o'')
plt.plot(metrics_df[''Threshold''], metrics_df[''Recall''], label=''Recall'', marker=''o'')
plt.plot(metrics_df[''Threshold''], metrics_df[''F1''], label=''F1-score'', marker=''o'')
plt.xlabel(''Threshold'')
plt.ylabel(''Score'')
plt.title(''Model Metrics Across Thresholds'')
plt.legend()
plt.grid(True)
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()'
